Job Title: Analyst, Sales Performance Management - GSC - US

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Company

US6469 Sysco Payroll, Division of Sysco Resources Services, LLC

Zip Code

77077

Minimum Level Of Education

Bachelor’s Degree

Minimum Years Of Experience

4 Years

Employment Type

Full Time

Travel Percentage

0

Compensation Range

$56,000.00 - $84,100.00

The compensation range provided is in compliance with state specific laws. Factors that may be used to determine your actual rate of pay include your specific skills, years of experience and other factors.

You may be eligible to participate in the Company's Incentive Plan.

Benefits Information

For information on Sysco’s Benefits, please visit https://SyscoBenefits.com

Summary

This role is responsible for providing analytical support, standard and ad hoc analysis, financial modeling, reporting and insights in support of the Sales Operation Performance Management Team. This role will support Sales, managing and leveraging large data sets with strong attention to detail. This position will work cross-functionally across Sales, Revenue Management and Finance, with the primary objective of enabling sales leadership to make effective and analytical driven decisions.

Responsibilities

Under the direction of the Sales Performance Management Senior Manager, the primary responsibility for this position is to provide insights and analytics to support the execution of GSC, Market and Region Key Initiatives. This position will provide timely communication and collaboration with Sales leaders.

Analyze performance and productivity data to support performance management effortsExtract large data sets to forecast monthly/qtrly/annual performanceUnderstand key metrics to include outside data, year over year performance and run rates in relation to overall company goalsAssist in the development and reporting of key performance metrics to help increase sales productivityLiaison between the Sales Team and Sales Performance Management Team for all compensation related inquiriesDevelops strong working relationships cross-functionallyLearns quickly when facing new challenges; thrives on a fast-paced environmentAdapts well to change and views new experiences as growth opportunities

Qualifications

Education and/or Experience:

4-year bachelor’s degree in a related field or 6-7 years of experience managing and analyzing large data sets4+ years in a sales support professional role, 4+ years in a professional analytical role, or a combination of relevant education and experienceFoodservice distribution or similar industry experience preferredExperience in sales performance management, including analyzing incentive and sales metrics, identifying trends, and providing insights to potentially identify gaps within incentive plans preferredTrack record of improving sales performance through data-driven insights and strategies. This could involve experience in sales process optimization, sales incentive design, or territory planning, showcasing a proactive approach to driving revenue growth.Experience in collaborating with multiple departments and can effectively work across functions bring added value to the team.Experience in strategic planning, compensation analysis, and sales forecasting. Demonstrates an ability to think strategically and contribute to the long-term growth and success of the team.

Professional Skills

Solid analytical problem-solving skills, including familiarity with analyzing reports and deriving insights from dataAdvance knowledge in Excel, modeling, and data manipulationFlexible; readily accepts change, open to new ideasStrong interpersonal skills and ability to work with a variety of key stakeholdersStrong communication skills, ability to effectively communicate with internal and external teamsProficient in Microsoft Applications Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook)Excellent organizational skills, including the ability to execute multiple initiatives at the same timeProactive, self-directed, ability to structure a weekly schedule to be successfulAbility to handle matters of a confidential nature

Overview

Sysco is the global leader in foodservice distribution. With over 71,000 colleagues and a fleet of over 13,000 vehicles, Sysco operates approximately 333 distribution facilities worldwide and serves more than 700,000 customer locations.

We offer our colleagues the opportunity to grow personally and professionally, to contribute to the success of a dynamic organization, and to serve others in a manner that exceeds their expectations. We’re looking for talented, hard-working individuals to join our team. Come grow with us and let us show you why Sysco is at the heart of food and service.

Affirmative Action Statement

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other protected factor under federal, state or local law.

This opportunity is available through Sysco Corporation, its subsidiaries and affiliates.

Anticipated Close Date

05/17/2024

The deadline may be extended in good faith based on business needs. The posting will be updated when the deadline is extended.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
